message.content:
cs.FL, cs.DS, cs.LO, cs.IT, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with language classes and decidability, which are typical topics in formal languages and automata theory (cs.FL). The use of closure properties and unboundedness problems suggests a connection to formal language theory and computational complexity (cs.DS, cs.LO). The mention of regularity and effective regularity also suggests a connection to information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the study of separability and common patterns may be related to computational complexity and algorithms (cs.CC).
